welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
# Collection

Utility data structure used in Discord.js.

classes.name: Collection
classes.description:
A Map with additional utility methods. This is used throughout discord.js rather than Arrays for anything that has
an ID, for significantly improved performance and ease-of-use.

methods.name: [iterator]
methods.description: Returns an iterable of entries in the map.

methods.name: at
methods.description:
Identical to [Array.at()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/at).
Returns the item at a given index, allowing for positive and negative integers.
Negative integers count back from the last item in the collection.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the element to obtain

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates an identical shallow copy of this collection.

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection. None of the source collections are modified.

params.name: collections
params.description: Collections to merge

methods.name: difference
methods.description: The difference method returns a new structure containing items where the key is present in one of the original structures but not the other.

params.name: other
params.description: The other Collection to filter against

methods.name: each
methods.description:
Identical to
[Map.forEach()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/forEach),
but returns the collection instead of undefined.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to execute for each element

methods.name: entries
methods.description: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the map.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this collection shares identical items with another.
This is different to checking for equality using equal-signs, because
the collections may be different objects, but contain the same data.

params.name: collection
params.description: Collection to compare with

methods.returnsDescription: Whether the collections have identical contents

methods.name: every
methods.description:
Checks if all items passes a test. Identical in behavior to
[Array.every()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/every).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

methods.name: filter
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter),
but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to test with (should return boolean)

methods.name: find
methods.description:
Searches for a single item where the given function returns a truthy value. This behaves like
[Array.find()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/find).
<warn>All collections used in Discord.js are mapped using their `id` property, and if you want to find by id you
should use the `get` method. See
[MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/get) for details.</warn>

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to test with (should return boolean)

methods.name: findKey
methods.description:
Searches for the key of a single item where the given function returns a truthy value. This behaves like
[Array.findIndex()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/findIndex),
but returns the key rather than the positional index.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to test with (should return boolean)

methods.name: first
methods.description: Obtains the first value(s) in this collection.
methods.returnsDescription: A single value if no amount is provided or an array of values, starting from the end if amount is negative

methods.name: firstKey
methods.description: Obtains the first key(s) in this collection.
methods.returnsDescription:
A single key if no amount is provided or an array of keys, starting from the end if
amount is negative

methods.name: flatMap
methods.description:
Maps each item into a Collection, then joins the results into a single Collection. Identical in behavior to
[Array.flatMap()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/flatMap).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces a new Collection

methods.name: hasAll
methods.description: Checks if all of the elements exist in the collection.

params.name: keys
params.description: The keys of the elements to check for

methods.returnsDescription: `true` if all of the elements exist, `false` if at least one does not exist.

methods.name: hasAny
methods.description: Checks if any of the elements exist in the collection.

params.name: keys
params.description: The keys of the elements to check for

methods.returnsDescription: `true` if any of the elements exist, `false` if none exist.

methods.name: intersect
methods.description: The intersect method returns a new structure containing items where the keys are present in both original structures.

params.name: other
params.description: The other Collection to filter against

methods.name: keyAt
methods.description:
Identical to [Array.at()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/at).
Returns the key at a given index, allowing for positive and negative integers.
Negative integers count back from the last item in the collection.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the key to obtain

methods.name: keys
methods.description: Returns an iterable of keys in the map

methods.name: last
methods.description: Obtains the last value(s) in this collection.
methods.returnsDescription:
A single value if no amount is provided or an array of values, starting from the start if
amount is negative

methods.name: lastKey
methods.description: Obtains the last key(s) in this collection.
methods.returnsDescription:
A single key if no amount is provided or an array of keys, starting from the start if
amount is negative

methods.name: map
methods.description:
Maps each item to another value into an array. Identical in behavior to
[Array.map()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new array, taking three arguments

methods.name: mapValues
methods.description:
Maps each item to another value into a collection. Identical in behavior to
[Array.map()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new collection, taking three arguments

methods.name: partition
methods.description:
Partitions the collection into two collections where the first collection
contains the items that passed and the second contains the items that failed.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

methods.name: random
methods.description: Obtains unique random value(s) from this collection.
methods.returnsDescription: A single value if no amount is provided or an array of values

methods.name: randomKey
methods.description: Obtains unique random key(s) from this collection.
methods.returnsDescription: A single key if no amount is provided or an array

methods.name: reduce
methods.description:
Applies a function to produce a single value. Identical in behavior to
[Array.reduce()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/reduce).

params.name: fn
params.description:
Function used to reduce, taking four arguments; `accumulator`, `currentValue`, `currentKey`,
and `collection`

params.name: initialValue
params.description: Starting value for the accumulator

methods.name: some
methods.description:
Checks if there exists an item that passes a test. Identical in behavior to
[Array.some()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/some).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

methods.name: sort
methods.description:
The sort method sorts the items of a collection in place and returns it.
The sort is not necessarily stable in Node 10 or older.
The default sort order is according to string Unicode code points.

params.name: compareFunction
params.description:
Specifies a function that defines the sort order.
If omitted, the collection is sorted according to each character's Unicode code point value, according to the string conversion of each element.

methods.name: sorted
methods.description:
The sorted method sorts the items of a collection and returns it.
The sort is not necessarily stable in Node 10 or older.
The default sort order is according to string Unicode code points.

params.name: compareFunction
params.description:
Specifies a function that defines the sort order.
If omitted, the collection is sorted according to each character's Unicode code point value,
according to the string conversion of each element.

methods.name: sweep
methods.description: Removes items that satisfy the provided filter function.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

methods.name: tap
methods.description: Runs a function on the collection and returns the collection.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to execute

methods.name: values
methods.description: Returns an iterable of values in the map
